newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.African Nando's IPO 24 times over-subscribed.
newsitem.headline: S.African Nando's IPO 24 times over-subscribed.

text.p: South African fast food group Nando's Group Holdings said on Wednesday its initial public offer (IPO) to raise 15 million rand was 24 times over-subscribed and had brought in 361 million rand.
"It is a vote of confidence in our chain and Nando's concept," said the firm's chairman and founder Robbie Brozin.
Nando's is to be listed on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange's (JSE) Beverages, Hotel and Leisure sector on Friday.

Nando's, which has shown heady growth in number of outlets and profits in the past 10 years and more recently moved aggressively offshore, has forecast earnings growth at 6.25 cents a share in the year to end-February 1998, compared with an historical figure of 5.15 the year before.
